org.apache.hadoop.util

Class NodeHealthScriptRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.service.AbstractService
      • org.apache.hadoop.util.NodeHealthScriptRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Service

    public class NodeHealthScriptRunner
extends AbstractService
    The class which provides functionality of checking the health of the node using the configured node health script and reporting back to the service for which the health checker has been asked to report.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.apache.hadoop.service.Service

    • Method Detail

      • serviceInit

        protected void serviceInit(Configuration conf)
                    throws Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractService
        All initialization code needed by a service. This method will only ever be called once during the lifecycle of a specific service instance. Implementations do not need to be synchronized as the logic in AbstractService.init(Configuration) prevents re-entrancy. The base implementation checks to see if the subclass has created a new configuration instance, and if so, updates the base class value
        Overrides:
        serviceInit in class AbstractService
        Parameters:
        conf - configuration
        Throws:
        Exception - on a failure -these will be caught, possibly wrapped, and wil; trigger a service stop

        public boolean isHealthy()
        Gets the if the node is healthy or not
        Returns:

      • getHealthReport

        public String getHealthReport()
        Returns output from health script. if node is healthy then an empty string is returned.
        Returns:

        Returns:
        timestamp when node health script was last run

      • shouldRun

        public static boolean shouldRun(String healthScript)
        Method used to determine if or not node health monitoring service should be started or not. Returns true if following conditions are met:
        1. Path to Node health check script is not empty
        2. Node health check script file exists
        Returns:
        true if node health monitoring service can be started.

        Used only by tests to access the timer task directly
        Returns:
        the timer task
